ARABIC: فَرَجَعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ أَنتُمُ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They consulted among themselves and said, 'It is you yourselves who are wrongdoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then they thought and observed: "Surely you are yourselves unjust."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thereupon they turned to their (inner) selves and said (to themselves): "Surely it is you who are the wrong-doers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Thereupon they realized their own foolishness and said, "We ourselves are wrong-doers".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So they turned towards their own selves and (inwardly) said, “Indeed you yourselves are unjust.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then they turned to themselves and said: Surely you yourselves are the unjust;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So they returned one to another, and they said, 'Surely it is you who are the evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then they turned to one another and said, "It is you yourselves who are in the wrong,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They then turned to themselves, and said: verily ye it is who are the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thereat they came to themselves and said [to one another], ‘Indeed it is you who are the wrongdoers!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So they returned one to another saying, 'Surely, it is you who are the harmdoers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then they turned to one another, and said, “You yourselves are the wrongdoers.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:64] So they turned [thinking] to themselves, in reflection, and they said, to themselves: ‘Truly it is you who are the evildoers’, for worshipping that which cannot speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then gathered they apart) blaming themselves (and said) and their king Nimrod said: (Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers) towards Abraham.
